avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is predominantly low, at higher altitudes moderate. Small-sized snowdrift accumulations can still be triggered above the timberline. Avalanche prone locations occur particularly on steep, shady slopes. Especially on steep grass-covered slopes, small-to-medium sized glide-snow avalanches are possible. Caution below glide cracks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Beware small-sized snowdrift accumulations and gliding snow

snowpackStructure.comment: The fresh fallen snow and small-sized snowdrift accumulations from the last few days are settling increasingly and firming up. Particularly on steep grass-covered slopes, increasingly frequent glide cracks and heightened gliding snow have been observed.

tendency.highlights: To begin with, no significant change in the avalanche situation is anticipated.

weatherForecast.comment: A slight tendency of foehn winds on Sunday, sunny in the morning hours followed by widespread thin cloudbanks. In the afternoon it will turn gloomy, a few snowflakes are expected as evening nears. Temperature at 2000m: 0 degrees. High-altitude winds: moderate to brisk from south to southwest.

avalancheActivity.comment: Slab avalanches can be triggered in the old snow. Caution is urged on very steep, shady high altitude slopes. Small-sized snowdrift accumulations can be triggered with increasing frequency at ascending altitudes. Medium-sized slab avalanches can be triggerred by winter sports enthusiasts. Especially on steep grass-covered slopes, small-to-medium sized glide-snow avalanches continue to be possible. Be careful beneath glide cracks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution urged on steep, shady high-altitude slopes

snowpackStructure.comment: The fresh fallen snow and small-sized snowdrift accumulations from the last few days are settling increasingly and firming up. At heightened altitudes they were often deposited on top of faceted layers of old snow from late autumn. The bonding is poor in places. Older snowdrift accumulation can still be triggered in some places.

tendency.highlights: The persistent weak layer remains prone to triggering on high-altitude, steep shady slopes.

weatherForecast.comment: A slight tendency of foehn winds on Sunday, sunny in the morning hours followed by widespread thin cloudbanks. In the afternoon it will turn gloomy, a few snowflakes are expected as evening nears. Temperature at 2000m: 0 degrees. High-altitude winds: moderate to brisk from south to southwest.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanche danger is low. Only slides and small glide-snow avalanches are possible. In extremely steep terrain, small avalanches can be triggered by winter sports enthusiasts. Apart from being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to fall also require caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: The most recent fresh fallen snow has been able to settle significantly and firm up during the nocturnal hours. All in all, there is little snow on the ground. On steep, grass-covered slopes, glide cracks and small glide-snowslides have been reported.

tendency.highlights: Monday is expected to be quite sunny. No significant change in the avalanche situation is anticipated.

weatherForecast.comment: A slight tendency of foehn winds on Sunday, sunny in the morning hours followed by widespread thin cloudbanks. In the afternoon it will turn gloomy, a few snowflakes are expected as evening nears. Temperature at 2000m: 0 degrees. High-altitude winds: moderate to brisk from south to southwest.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Considerable avalanche danger at high altitudes
